title: US natural gas prices fall
keypoints: US natural gas futures held near a seven-week low due to market anticipation of a federal report showing smaller-than-usual storage builds for the eighth consecutive week.
Despite a bullish heat wave and increased gas usage for power generation, higher gas output in July and oversupply in storage have kept prices low.
Recent declines in front-month contracts led to an unusual premium for September futures over August.
Next-day gas prices at the Waha hub in West Texas dropped significantly due to pipeline constraints.
Gas output in the Lower 48 US states rose to an average of 101.8 billion cubic feet per day in July.

title: NNPC Declares State of Emergency on Crude Oil Production
keypoints: NNPC Ltd. declared a state of emergency on Nigeria's crude oil production, aiming to increase output and grow reserves.
A detailed asset analysis revealed Nigeria could produce two million barrels of crude oil per day without new rigs, but timely action is required.
NNPC Ltd. plans to replace old pipelines and introduce a rig-sharing program to boost production efficiency.
The company is committed to investing in critical midstream gas infrastructure to enhance domestic gas production and supply.
NNPC Ltd. has also invested in Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) stations as part of the Presidential CNG drive.

title: Williams project clears legal hurdle for Louisiana natural gas pipeline crossings
keypoints: A Louisiana court ruled in favor of Williams in its dispute with Energy Transfer LP, allowing the construction of the Louisiana Energy Gateway (LEG) pipeline crossings.
The LEG system is designed to supply LNG export terminals, crucial for the natural gas market.
Energy Transfer had attempted to block the construction, citing land use rights, but the court sided with Williams and its partners.
The ruling removes a significant obstacle for the LEG pipeline in northwestern Louisiana, facilitating natural gas transportation from the Haynesville Shale.
